purpose: To facilitate the creation and management of multi-agent systems using a Kanban-style approach for improved organization and workflow.
principle: Built on JavaScript, leveraging a Kanban-inspired methodology to structure and coordinate interactions between multiple agents.
reusability: Offers a modular design with plugins and APIs for easy integration and customization in JavaScript projects.
limitations: Currently in alpha stage, may lack comprehensive documentation and full feature set, primarily targeted at JavaScript environments.
name: KaibanJS
description: KaibanJS is a JavaScript-native framework for building and managing multi-agent systems  with a Kanban-inspired approach.
highlight: Kanban-inspired framework for managing multi-agent systems in JavaScript.
